# Graphics Concepts Understanding the fundamental concepts of Vista Graphics is essential for creating effective custom graphics and visualizations. ## Key Concepts - [Graphics Overview](/wiki/graphics/concepts/graphics-overview/) - Introduction to Vista Graphics - [Draw Model](/wiki/graphics/concepts/draw-model/) - Drawing dialect concepts - [Coordinate Systems](/wiki/graphics/concepts/coordinate-systems/) - Math, center, and VID coordinates - [Canvas Basics](/wiki/graphics/concepts/canvas-basics/) - Canvas setup and usage ## Coordinate Systems Vista Graphics supports multiple coordinate systems: - **Math Coordinates**: Origin at center, Y points up - **VID Coordinates**: Origin at top-left, Y points down - **Canvas Coordinates**: Pixel-based positioning ## See Also - [Tutorials](/wiki/graphics/tutorials/) - Learning guides - [Drawing](/wiki/graphics/drawing/) - Drawing reference
